title: Health Care Down on Backlash Fears — Health Care Roundup | Morningstar
text:
Health Care Down on Backlash Fears — Health Care Roundup
Health-care companies fell amid ongoing concerns about a backlash against the industry.
The SPDR Select Sector Health Care exchange-traded fund, which tracks the health-care industry group of the S&P 500, turned negative for the year, giving back substantial gains.
Roche shares slipped after the Swiss drug giant said a Parkinson's disease experimental drug missed its primary goal in a mid-stage trial, the second setback this week for candidate treatments for the neurodegenerative condition.
The Food and Drug Administration said a longstanding shortage of Eli Lilly's weight-loss drug Zepbound and its Type 2 diabetes medicine Mounjaro is officially over.
Vertex shares fell after it reported mixed trial results for a treatment for lumbosacral radiculopathy, a neurological disorder that causes back and leg pain.
Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
December 19, 2024 18:24 ET (23:24 GMT)
